IndexedDemultiplexer_Event

This component is used to fire an event corresponding to the index of the integer data input [In]Ind. When the input event [In]Go is triggered, either the output event is fired that corrsponds to the index of [In]Ind, or if the index of [In]Ind exceeds the number of event outputs, then the overflow event [Out]Overflow is fired and the value of the output [Out]Offset is set to the value of the input [In]Ind minus the number of event outputs. The overflow event [Out]Overflow is used to cascade components of this type by passing the overflow event [Out]Overflow and the data output [Out]Offset to the input of the next component in the cascade.

Ports

  • [In] Go:

    Event input, triggers the output event corresponding to the value of input [In]Ind.

  • [Out] --:

    Event output, triggered when the input event [In]Go is triggered.

  • [In] Ind:

    Data input, index of the event to be fired.

  • [Out] Offset:

    Data output, value of the index minus the number of event outputs.

  • [Out] 1:

    Event output 1.

  • [Out] 2:

    Event output 2.

  • [Out] 3:

    Event output 3.

  • [Out] 4:

    Event output 4.

  • [Out] 5:

    Event output 5.

  • [Out] 6:

    Event output 6.

  • [Out] 7:

    Event output 7.

  • [Out] 8:

    Event output 8.

  • [Out] Overflow:

    Event output, fired if the index of [In]Ind exceeds the number of event outputs.

Parameters

None.

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
